main event: Radar detected a large, indefinite object moving at high speed (approximately 2,300 knots) in the Pacific Ocean.
interesting points: The object appeared elliptical in shape on the radar scope.
The object was observed at altitudes between 15,000 and 23,992 feet.
The sighting was made by a Navy Captain, Paul Cosciarelli, who was on board an aircraft.
The weather conditions at the time of the sighting were cloudy with high-altitude stratus clouds and winds of 25 degrees at 12 knots.
The sighting lasted for approximately 4 minutes on radar.
